EM waves at the VLF and=A0ULF level can give off sound but only as a second=
ary phenomenon. It sounds like a low hum to some people! I believe the most=
 famous of these phenomenon was caused by HAARP.

 Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:

crombie <april@...>

as

Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 3:43 PM








=

So everything can be defined as from one of these forces. Objects=A0from t=
hese forces can omit sound waves.
=A0
Does that sound like a correct statem=
ent? Just trying to get my mind around it.
=A0

----- Original Message ----=
- 
From: Rj 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:33=
 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas







April, standard physics today d=
efines four fundamental types of forces: electromagnetism, gravity,=A0 and =
the strong and weak interaction of elementary particles.=A0 So while EM is =
one type of energy (well, lets call it a force), there are a few others too=
.


--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch.=
 com> wrote:

m>

this far, but I am still not certain I understand it completely.
=A0

ght everything was based in the electromagnetic spectrum.
=A0
----- Origina=
l Message ----- 

From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Mo=
nday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








Tell m=
e where the seperation on the spectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz=
. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves that our ears read as vibration and =
our mind translates as sound. The waves are still on the electromagnetic sp=
ectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are present on the scale. What I me=
an by power can be directll translated to volume or amplitude. The only thi=
ng that distinguishes soundwaves from any other wave is the fact that we ca=
n hear them.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wro=
te:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM








No. Sou=
nds waves are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are they a form of elec=
tromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on pressure waves in the air (or in=
 other substances).=A0 Our ears detect these pressure waves and translate t=
hem into sounds we here.=A0 Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy.=A0 Ou=
r eyes do: that part which we call visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Fr=
ank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18ei=
i@ yahoo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com=

Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM









It sounds like she's saying =
"one, two, ....."
=A0
A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that =
there are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound wave=
s and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequenc=
y and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain bloc=
k of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum=
 just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves ca=
n penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the w=
avelength the more ways we can shield against them.
=A0
Think of microwaves=
. These are also a type of radio and telemetry transmitting wave but the wa=
ves also have a physical effect on our environment by causing molecules to =
speed up, which creates heat. A little lower than this is IR or infrared it=
 too can cause physical objects to heat up but usually it just causes molec=
ules to rotate in place. All physical things give off IR light. Its a way t=
he total system conserves energy by spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh os=
tresearch. com> wrote:


From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostre=
search. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food =
for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 30th investigat=
ion.
=A0
It was me and another girl teammate=A0present in the room. I picke=
d up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. =
We were standing right next to another digital video recorder that I leave =
beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice=
. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if s=
he picked it up.
=A0
I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound=
 waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied vo=
ice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=A0
This insta=
nce with the recorders may back that theory up. That other recorder should =
have picked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.
=A0
I =
am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-=
17 Clip" is the full clip.=A0You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and th=
en another comes in right after that. I think I know what it says.
=A0
Agai=
n, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until playba=
ck. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from the la=
st investigation.
=A0
=A0

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka =

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject:=
 Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








I have a running theory that EVP is carrie=
d on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manif=
est. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves=
 that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them toge=
ther you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a gho=
st is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room crea=
ting an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate dif=
ference=A0frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz=
). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultraso=
nic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EV=
P were generated within a few inches of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to re=
produce this affect in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also=
 with acoustics and audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produc=
e called the "audio spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

Fascinating! I've had this=
 idea that the EVP are often=A0not recorded by the microphone but somehow m=
ake their way in at the actual=A0point where the storage is made, whether i=
t be analog (tape) or digital.=A0

So much we don't know ...
=A0
Zack

=A0

On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostr=
esearch. com> wrote:









I monitor my audio live. The funny thing is t=
hat even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not hear either in the envir=
onment, or on my recording as it happened. I only heard them upon playback.=

=A0


----- Original Message ----- 
From: Zack Widup 

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogr=
oups .com 



Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] N=
ew ideas




I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote sit=
e has ever gotten any EVP in real time.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investiga=
tion of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six vid=
eo cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all=A0w=
as being monitored and recorded=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not h=
ave microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I won=
der what we might have heard if we did?
=A0
Zack

=A0

<DIV>A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that the=

st farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can p=
enetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wave=
length the more ways we can shield against them.</DIV>

y it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical things give off=

tting IR radiation.</DIV>

<DIV>I have a running theory that EVP is carried on =
an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want it to manifest. =
It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that=
 differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtract them together =
you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is=
 sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in a room creating =
an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a intermediate differen=
ce frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz).=
 This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generates ultrasoni=
c signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always felt that EVP =
were generated within a few inches of the recorder.</DIV>

<DIV>I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a rem=
ote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV=
>I took part in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore=
 IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls =
of the building. The video for all was being monitored and recorded&nb=
sp;at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera s=
ites conected to the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if=
 we did?</DIV>
